text: God Helps Israel
Listen to me in silence, coastlands,
and let nations renew \add their\add* strength.
Let them approach, then let them speak;
let us draw near together for judgment.
Who has roused salvation from the east,
summoned\f + \fr 41:2 \ft Or “called” \f* him to his foot,
gives nations ⸤in his presence⸥,\f + \fr 41:2 \ft Literally “before his face” \f*
and subjugates kings?
He makes\f + \fr 41:2 \ft Or “gives” \f* \add them\add* like the dust \add with\add* his sword,
like scattered stubble \add with\add* his bow.
He pursues them \add and\add* passes on \add in\add* peace;
he does not enter \add the\add* path with his feet.
Who has accomplished and done \add this\add*,
calling the generations from \add the\add* ⸤beginning⸥?\f + \fr 41:4 \ft Literally “head” \f*
I, Yahweh, \add am\add* first;
and I \add am\add* the one with \add the\add* last.
\add The\add* coastlands have seen and are afraid;
the ends of the earth tremble.
They have drawn near,
and they have come.
Each one helps\f + \fr 41:6 \ft Hebrew “help” \f* his neighbor;
he says to his brother, “Take courage!”
And \add the\add* artisan encourages \add the\add* ⸤goldsmith⸥,\f + \fr 41:7 \ft Literally “refiner” \f*
\add the\add* one who makes smooth with \add the\add* hammer \add encourages the\add* one who strikes \add the\add* anvil,
saying of the soldering, “It \add is\add* good!”
And they strengthen it with nails \add so\add* it cannot be knocked over.
But\f + \fr 41:8 \ft Or “And” \f* you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen,
you, the ⸤offspring⸥\f + \fr 41:8 \ft Literally “seed” \f* of Abraham my ⸤friend⸥,\f + \fr 41:8 \ft Literally “beloved” \f*
you whom I grasped from the ends of the earth
and called from its remotest parts
and told, “You \add are\add* my servant;
I have chosen you and I have not rejected you.”
You must not fear, for I \add am\add* with you;
you must not be afraid, for I \add am\add* your God.
I will strengthen you, indeed I will help you,
indeed I will take hold of you with the right hand of my salvation.
Look! All those who are angry with you shall be ashamed and humiliated;
⸤your opponents⸥\f + \fr 41:11 \ft Literally “the men of your strife” \f* shall be like nothing and shall become lost.
You shall seek them,
but\f + \fr 41:12 \ft Or “and” \f* you shall not find them;
⸤your opponents⸥\f + \fr 41:12 \ft Literally “the men of your strife” \f* shall be like nothing,
and the men of your war like nothing.
For I, Yahweh your God, \add am\add* grasping your right hand;
⸤it is I who say⸥\f + \fr 41:13 \ft Literally “the sayer” \f* to you,
“You must not fear;
I myself, I will help you.
You must not fear, O worm of Jacob;
people of Israel,
I myself, I will help you,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 41:14 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and your redeemer \add is\add* the holy one of Israel.
Look! I will make you into a new sharp threshing sledge,
⸤with⸥\f + \fr 41:15 \ft Literally “owner of” \f* sharp edges.
You shall thresh and crush \add the\add* mountains,
and you shall make \add the\add* hills like chaff.
You shall winnow them and \add the\add* wind shall carry them,
and \add the\add* tempest shall scatter them.
And you yourself shall rejoice in Yahweh;
you shall boast in the holy one of Israel.
The poor and the needy \add are\add* seeking water and \add there is\add* none;
their tongue is dried up with thirst.
I, Yahweh, will answer them;
I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
I will open rivers on \add the\add* barren heights
and fountains in \add the\add* midst of \add the\add* valleys.
I will make \add the\add* wilderness like a pool of water
and \add the\add* land of dryness like springs of water.
I will ⸤put⸥\f + \fr 41:19 \ft Literally “give” \f* \add the\add* cedar, acacia, myrtle, and olive oil tree in the wilderness;
I will set \add the\add* cypress, elm, and box tree together in the desert
so that they may see and know,
and take to heart and understand together
that the hand of Yahweh has done this,
and the holy one of Israel has created it.”
“Present your legal case,” says Yahweh.
“Bring your evidence,” says the king of Jacob.
Let them bring \add them\add*,
and let them tell us what will happen.
Tell us what the former things \add are\add*
⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 41:22 \ft Or “And” \f* we may take \add them to\add* our heart
and know their outcome.\f + \fr 41:22 \ft Or “end” \f*
Declare to us the things to come;
tell \add us\add* the things coming ⸤hereafter⸥,\f + \fr 41:23 \ft Literally “later” \f*
that\f + \fr 41:23 \ft Or “and” \f* we may know that you \add are\add* gods.
Indeed, do good or\f + \fr 41:23 \ft Or “and” \f* do evil,
that\f + \fr 41:23 \ft Or “and” \f* we may be afraid and see\f + \fr 41:23 \ft Following the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ); the written text (\fqa Kethib \ft ) has “fear” \f* together.
Look! you \add are\add* nothing,
and your work \add is\add* something worthless;
whoever chooses you \add is\add* an abomination.
I stirred up \add one\add* from \add the\add* north,
and he has come from \add the\add* rising of the sun.
He shall call on my name,
and he shall come \add on\add* officials as \add on\add* mortar,
and as \add the\add* ⸤potter⸥\f + \fr 41:25 \ft Literally “creator” \f* treads clay.
Who declared \add it\add* from \add the\add* ⸤beginning⸥\f + \fr 41:26 \ft Literally “head” \f* ⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 41:26 \ft Or “and” \f* we might know,
and ⸤beforehand⸥\f + \fr 41:26 \ft Literally “from before faces” \f* ⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 41:26 \ft Or “and” \f* we might say, “\add He is\add* ⸤right⸥!”\f + \fr 41:26 \ft Literally “righteous” \f*
Indeed, there was no one who declared \add it\add*;
Indeed, there was no one who proclaimed \add it\add*.
Indeed there was no one who heard your words.
First to Zion, look! Look at them!
And I give a herald\f + \fr 41:27 \ft Or “bringer” \f* of good tidings to Jerusalem.
But\f + \fr 41:28 \ft Or “And” \f* I look and there is no man,
and \add I look\add* among these and there is no counselor,
that\f + \fr 41:28 \ft Or “and” \f* I might ask them and they might answer a word.
Look! All of them \add are\add* deception;
their works \add are\add* nothing;
their images \add are\add* wind and emptiness.
